6.author: throwawayacc1587
6.body: I didn't mean you personally I meant people in general could relate to Sanjis backstory more than others in the crew. Some are just impossible too like Brook. No one has watched everyone they love die then die themselves and return to their skeleton body. Not a lot of people could relate to everyone and everything they love being destroyed by a government body and chased as a criminal just for surviving it either like Robin. Even Namis backstory of being held hostage by a terrorist/pirate organization and committing crimes to free them is a rare situation most could not relate to. But Sanji's backstory is actually pretty relatable. Being looked at/treated differently/abused by his family because he wasn't the same as his siblings and running away from it all only to have to confront it later on (because he couldn't hide it forever) is actually a very relatable story to our real world. Just the basic story of abuse by a parent to that degree causing a lifetime of harm and trauma is a story many people unfortunately can relate to. Luffys is also very relatable and Usopps as well. I think Sanji is just a more fleshed character though.

8.author: Ruffeep
8.body:
Hmm it looks like their profits fell in 2009, but I can't really see any evidence that Dragonball Evolution had much to do with it. It wasn't even seen by that many people you know, it was a huge flop, so I have a hard time seeing it have a big effect on the popularity of Dragonball merch, especially since Dragonball's popularity had been running on fumes for a long time by then, since the manga had ended a long time ago, and GT being a bit of a flop too. Until Battle of Gods, there wasn't that much to get Dragonball fans to keep encaging with the series.

Also don't you think that rather than a movie that couldn't even scrape 10 million dollars in American box office, the fall of the profits might have been caused by the financial crisis? I don't think many companies were filing huge gains in 2009, and somehow I doubt all of them had a bad live action adaptation based on their manga series.

8.author: HokageEzio
8.body:
They never said Dragonball was unpopular though, so your point makes no sense.  Saying "look how popular Super is" doesn't really counter saying that Evolution hurt its popularity.  I don't know where that claim is coming from, I just think that your retort makes no sense.  It's completely possible for Evolution to have hurt sales and for the new Toriyama movies to have brought it back.

Toriyama being upset about how garbage Evolution was is actually what made him do Battle of Gods.

8.author: Ruffeep
8.body:
I think my logic is pretty damn simple.

The discussion is about if bad adaption can hurt the popularity of source material

Dragonball had the worst adaptation possible, but their franchise is still doing amazing to this day.

So the simple conclusion is that with an ongoing popular series like One Piece, a bad adaptation, even on the level of Dragonball Evolution, is very unlikely to do any harm to the property. Maybe it'll do some financial harm, but as with Dragonball being very popular to this day, so would One Piece survive and go on being pretty much as popular as always, as did Dragonball.

8.author: HokageEzio
8.body:
The logic of saying "Dragonball is still popular and recovered from Evolution" is fine.  The logic of saying "Dragonball Evolution didn't hurt the series because Super is popular" is ignoring that there's a decade of time and multiple things in between those two points that could have made Super more popular (and did).

>So the simple conclusion is that with an ongoing popular series like One Piece, a bad adaptation, even on the level of Dragonball Evolution, is very unlikely to do any harm to the property.

I don't think a blanket statement like that applies.  Dragonball Z was massively popular in the west and a large part of people's childhoods.  To this day.  One Piece on the other hand was massively impacted by having 4Kids do the adaptation to start with, and by the time Funimation got it TV and blocks like Toonami were way less popular than when shows like DBZ or Naruto became classics.  A bad adaptation can definitely sour getting newer people into the show, because One Piece *isn't* Dragonball.  One Piece was always a harder show to get into, that's what the adaptation is aiming to fix.

Personally I think it'll be a fine adaptation, but I don't think you can just say "well DBZ lived" when DBZ is a way bigger household name for the audience that this live action is trying to reach.

8.author: Ruffeep
8.body:
Well yeah One Piece is a smaller name than Dragonball was in the west, but that just means that there is even less risk of the popularity falling because of a bad adaptation. So what's the harm? A few more people who were never going to read One Piece anyway won't get into it because they didn't really feel the live action show? 

And yeah the 4kids adaptation hurt a lot, but that was because there was no alternative at the time. Times have changed, and whatever kind of product the live action show is, nobody will be stuck with it in the west, since we already have the show in manga and anime format widely available.

8.author: HokageEzio
8.body: I think saying that the people who would be put off by the live action are just people who would never have watched is disingenuous.  The main goal of the live action is to reach those people who are interested but the anime is super long and they're not sure about getting started.  There's a lot of people out there who are only put off by the length of the series, and that's where a good adaptation can help or a bad adaptation can hurt in creating another boom for the series.

The reason why I said no need to reply is because we both know that you're not going to accept the truth but okay if you really want to we can have a pointless debate for a bit:

From the beginning Yamato admitted he didn't have a chance against Kaido and Yamato's only goal was to hold Kaido off until Luffy showed up.

Yamato was not trading equal blows to Kaido - Yamato clashed with Kaido but it doesn't mean they were equal in attacks overall or anything. The best example of the difference in strength is when both used thunder bagua and since it is the same move and requires the same effort it is the best way to compare - Yamato used a defence shell but it was destroyed and was a failure shown later when Yamato said "That thunder bagua, I thought I blocked it but I didn't even come close" and there is a bunch of blood coming out however Kaido only had a few drops on his head and shows no marks later. Yamato blocked a few hits and equaled out blast breath, that is not trading equal blows at all, we also saw Yamato getting overwhelmed a few times by Kaido.

Yamato also has not shown to have or use future sight, in general the only characters shown to have future sight in Wano were Kaido and Luffy. Yamato also has not shown advanced armament, well at least internal destruction since with normal advanced armament it is hard to tell.

Throughout their short fight Kaido was completely fine and most of the time had zero marks however Yamato consistently had blood, marks, and would say "huff, huff". Even after the fight Yamato was still huffing and was clearly injured despite being a mythical zoan. Although Yamato hadn't reached his limit even when Kaido was reaching his limit Yamato with Momo still thought they would die against him.

Kaido was also not going all out, he took Yamato seriously but we see later more and stronger moves with Luffy. 

There is also the question with Yamato's fruit - he clearly had the same affect as every other controlled zoan awakening and if that is the case the fact Yamato still took so long to heal and was clearly quite injured after the fight speaks volumes.

The fact is other than a few attacks where Yamato blocked or equalised Yamato would be heavily overwhelmed and came out very injured while Kaido maybe had a mark from Yamato for a panel of two then went. Yamato did a good job, he managed to hold off for a short time and would still be able to carry on going, Yamato also contributed to Kaido start to become tired which is impressive but there is nothing to put him equal or stronger than Luffy (that's presuming you still think Yamato is that strong). 

You could make an argument for Yamato being stronger than Zoro but that's it and it's not like either being a lot stronger than the other.

All we know is that the great kingdom had some immense power and was much more advanced than the current world is today. For some UKNOWN reason the 20 kingdoms that formed the world government attacked it and subsequently erased both it and the 100 years before so that the information would never spread. The kingdom of alabasta was apart of these twenty kingdoms, but after the victory the rulers of alabasta the nefertari family did not go to marie jois. They did however as far as we know participate in the destruction of the kingdom. Furthermore Wanos involvement seemed to be purely the creation of the poneglyphs, after the events of the void century they cut off their borders and due to the walls they erected they moved higher up and became more isolated. The One Piece was left by Joy Boy and subsequently he seemed to have placed the poneglyphs since he left his own messages on them. We dont know who was tyrannical, who was the bad guy, maybe it was all a ploy by Imus ancestors to give them power, we dont know the details on most of the void centuries conflict.

45.author: -Lige
45.body:
Okay, so if he touches something he can create a sentient creature from it? Or he can turn something into diamond? Or he can levitate an object after touching it? He can change the properties of the object to be a devil fruit? If he touches it he can change the material to be hotter than the sun?

45.author: mestarien_mestari
45.body:
I understand you are arguing in bad faith, but I will try address your arguments in this comment.

As a baseline, if the ability is literally another devil fruit, Oda probably won’t give Gear 5th that ability.

Touching something and turning it into a sentient creature? That is Big Moms fruit and probably wont be a Gear 5th power.

Turning something into a diamond? Probably. He transmuted his hair into a pair of goggles, maybe he can transmute a giant wukong staff or something from his body.

Levitate an object after touching it? His punch turns it into cartoon rubber and he could blow air into and float it like a balloon.

Making a material hotter than the sun? Sun God Nika fruit lets him ignite his punches, and since he can turn anything into cartoon rubber he could probably ignite it to be “Hotter than the sun”

If Luffy can imagine doing something, he can do it in Gear 5th if he is physically touching it.

45.author: -Lige
45.body:
I’m not arguing in bad faith. I’m trying to have you understand that labeling his power with a definition of “turning his imagination into reality” is busted as fuck and goes way past anything OP. The definition you’re trying to give, is saying that he’s limitless, and it’s a no limit fallacy. 

All of the things he does is not too far out there, it’s playful and he can do crazy things, sure. But I doubt he has limitless power that goes above universal - 4d. 

Also just because he can create heat using his punches doesn’t automatically mean he can theoretically make it hotter than the sun. That again is a no limit fallacy. But sure, it has the potential to happen because we don’t know the extent of his powers. It’s the devils proof, and speculation at that point, not fact 

Having his power be “turning his imagination into reality” automatically means he can use everyone else’s powers, that’s ridiculous. That of course includes time manipulation. He would be able to use everyone else’s devil fruit powers, but even stronger than what their own potential could be. That means he can use powers which would be above everyone else’s awakened fruits, because it works off of his imagination... And I’m saying that that is ridiculous. 

Everything I said fits the definition of “turning his imagination into reality”. Do you understand what I mean now?

45.author: mestarien_mestari
45.body:
This is One Piece, the manga where Luffy “blew air into his bones” to make his punch stronger. This was later retconned with the reveal that Luffy ate a Mythical Zoan God Fruit, and he was actually altering reality by imagining that blowing air into his arm would make it stronger (yes he is still rubber).

68.author: OJONLYMAYBEDIDIT
68.body:
there are other powers that are always active. Buggy's power is always active. I would think Alvida's is always active.   


Brook's is obviously always active. It may have been done just for gags, but Mr. 3 seemed to be a wax-man at all times and thus was even more affected by heat than the others in Impel Down.   


honestly, that's less evidence and more just practicality. having to turn on rubber mode would have been soooo annoying to draw and write.

68.author: Viking_fairy
68.body:
oh, I never thought oda would pull out something so cool.. I just figured his fruit was a little special, just a little rarer than others. 

as for buggy and Mr 3, pretty sure they've been shown getting hit when surprised and their power not saving them... seems to be the biggest weakness of paramecia. of course, can't really show buggy's power "not activating" explicitly narratively... cause that'd mean he'd have to get pretty brutality cut.

68.author: Viking_fairy
68.body:
actually, a thought just occurred to me... some fruits also permanently alter the user's body... this is not an activation, but a necessity for the fruit to work. good examples of this are alvida, who wouldn't even be able to walk if her power was always on... and wapo, who's power required his body to be able to eat anything...

now, this thought... I think luffy hasn't actually been using his devil fruit power this entire time. he's been using the rubber change which is necessary to utilize his fruit, but never actually "activated" it til now... huh, I gots me a theory! woot!

73.author: IamSam1103
73.body:
>Small increase in Exoskeleton (but not enough to attain innate abilities such as his siblings' electricity or poison)

Wait didn't he awaken his ability of invisibility though? I mean it's not perfect of course, but he has awakened his innate ability though. Rest I agree, but his exoskeleton was a big thing. He was definitely fragile compared to the likes of Zoro, Jimbei and maybe even franky. How he's the toughest of them all, right behind Luffy.

73.author: arryeka
73.body:
He stopped the gene awakening midway, that's why he retains his emotions but not complete the abilities from Exo. 

He attains that invisibility through sheer superspeed, not from Exoskeleton. It cost stamina and needs space, whereas innate invisibility can be done while standing still.

Sanji is still behind Franky's front side in toughness. Franky's front is completely unfazed by bullets, whereas Sanji is still got tickled by bullet. However, yeah, overall durability he's better now.

73.author: IamSam1103
73.body: Okay. Btw I wasn't talking about him being fast enough to be invisible to queen. He was starting to awaken his ability before that, so I thought he could slowly get that ability later. He needs the suits help rn. I didn't know that he forcefully stopped his awakening tbh.

73.author: arryeka
73.body:
Oh, yeah, the one with SFX that indicates invisibility right?

He felt weird when using the RS, so it's a fact that the transformation is caused/originated from it. Without the RS his transformation won't happen.

And Sanji only get iron skin & regeneration, and not the invisibility (an additional feature) , like his siblings. Which means it's a fact that his transformation is incomplete. 

Soon after that he destroyed the RS. Which means it's a fact that if he didn't destroy it, the RS will continue the transformation and give him invisibility. In conclusion, he forcefully stopped his awakening.

Maybe this is a future powerups for him, like from Vegapunk, him getting complete Exo and RS. This is the only way I can think of Sanji to barely reach Emperor level. This is needed because 1. his fellow Wings is gonna be at least mid Emperor level 2. he is PK's Wings, to respect PK title, Sanji needs to be that strong at least.

What do you think

73.author: IamSam1103

Our difference lies in that he will not get that innate ability, because I think it's risky to taint Sanji's character by having invisibility power that can be used to peep. Invisibility via speed can't be done in such closed bathroom space, so Sanji is safe & won't be named a real creep.

78.author: lololuser456778
78.body:
>Law could do it and do you know who BM called out after receiving both attacks with Kid going after Law? BM called out Law so clearly his attack stuck out more

  
did she need to call out kid? her lower arm was completely broken and useless. there's no need to call out the obvious. law's damage had to be called out cuz we didn't see it. if BM wouldn't have said anything, then everybody would have thought that law did nothing. 

  
and everything that was said for law was shown in action for kid. BM didn't say law's attacks are more dangerous than kid's, she said that they are dangerous in general and that she needs to watch out for them (in other words she doesn't wanna get hit by law's attacks)

  
and what happens right after that? kid attacks, we see BM's scared face when she realizes she can't pull herself off of the assigned tower and then she uses all her physical strength (veins popping up on her face) to turn the entire tower around just to not get hit by kid.

  
everything said for law needed to be said cuz we can't see any of the damage he dealt. everything said for him also applies to kid. his moves are also dangerous to BM which is why she dodges, it's the exact same as law. if oda wanted to tell us that law deals more damage than kid, then he would have clearly shown that. and he didn't do that. BM didn't say that law hits harder than kid and she wanted to evade kid's attacks just as much as law's. 

​

>  
not to mention later when we see the image of the damage done to Wano it was Law's final attack which was purely his df (to our knowledge) that caused a huge hole almost the size of Luffy's final attack. 

  
and literally overpowering BM counts for nothing? kid overpowered the one that can do ridiculous attacks like ikkoku with just physical might. and damned punk immediatly knocked her down on impact and kept pushing until it overpowered her

  
obviously law's attack looked more impressive, but that's also cuz of the nature of the attack and cuz it was his intention to punch a hole through the ground. but I greatly doubt that if kid was shooting his damned punk into the ground that it wouldn't also create a hole as deep as law's

  
and the one who was overall more impressive in the narrative sense is kid anyways. literally all his attacks got to be the cliffhangers of the chapters they were in and he also got the final attack to finish BM off, even with the classic beam struggle. and when we got the tower card symbolism, when the new tearing away the old was mentioned, we saw a close-up panel of kid and not law. say whatever you want, but oda's intention there was clear, he clearly focused more on kid

​

>  
Also just because Kaido didn't call it out doesn't mean Luffy didn't break Kaido's bones, he defeated Kaido for goodness sake.

  
luffy didn't break his bones until bajrang gun. his supreme/over kong gun hit kaido in the mouth while he was in dragon form and it didn't break a signle tooth. and if that attack didn't break kaido's bones, then roc guns or gatlings definitely didn't do that either. punk corna dio just is stronger than 99% of luffy's attacks. it's just that strong

​

  
and BM's final attack was stronger than kid's? do you mean misery? that for sure wasn't stronger than damned punk. and corna dio isn't that much of a "big attack" considering that kid used it twice in a row.

  
and BM healing those attacks was only significant during that battle, while kid and law were still inexperienced with their awakenings. looking at law vs BB, it seems like law already got used to his awakening since he used shockwille twice right off the bat and without huffing anymore. the same will go for kid. BM healing indefinitely doesn't matter when kid and law can break her bones indefinitely

  
and what do you mean by BM can exponentially increase her firepower? you mean her power-up by ingesting a year of her own lifespan? she just did that once. it's not a move she spams. even after being overpowered despite her powered up form which led to her ribs and arm being broken, she didn't power-up again, she just healed.

  
and her firepower isn't that great for kid considering that he tanked everything she threw at him. he tanked mama-raid even without having his guard up, he took misery and ikkoku and he also easily tanked fulgora despite being yeeted through the skull dome and several floors. both kid's and law's firepower are definitely greater than BM's firepower.

kid's DF is without a doubt a top-tier DF. any DF that can deal significant damage to someone as tanky as BM is automatically top-tier.

78.author: lololuser456778
78.body:
>Oda can easily write Law losing to BB but escaping and ending up in Elbaf. You make it sound as if it's impossible

I'm saying that escape is unlikely cuz oda himself kinda threw that scenario out of the window. BB himself said to law that there's no escape, probably cuz of van augur's warp fruit and BB's long range with his quake fruit

anywhere law goes, BB can teleport to with van augur. diving with the submarine is no option anyways, it all started by BB forcing law out of diving cuz he increased the water pressure with quakes.

78.author: lololuser456778
78.body:
Imo an admiral is unlikely since usually never more than one is leaving HQ at the same time.

But maybe shanks could come? He was near Wano last time we saw him. It seemed like he did wanna deal with barto, but maybe if he heard something of BB ambushing pirates on the routes that lie behind wano, maybe he'll turn around.

Other than a 3rd party coming directly to them, it's also a possibility that BB hears of Garp attacking his island. Maybe cuz Koby is too important for him to lose (we still don't know why exactly he even abducted him) or maybe just to protect his reputation as a yonko (can't let your main island you reside on get raided; garp invading and freeing koby Koby would be a similar disgrace BM had to endure cuz of luffy)


I also thought about law exchanging the RP rubbings for safety. But it doesn't make much sense. On the one hand, law is confident that he'll win and get BB's rubbings. If the fight doesn't go too well, then law may think of that idea

But, you need to be in a power position to make this deal happen. BB would only accept it if he wasn't sure if he could win. So if law proposes such a deal cuz it's not looking good for him, then BB wouldn't accept it anyways.

Only way it could happen is if law is even with BB (so much so that BB isn't sure anymore if he can win), but his crew is about to lose and die. And that could only happen if law would be truly a yonko level combatant now. I'd love that. A lot. But I won't bet on it for now 

Idk about the ship. Idk if it's that important to BB. If it isn't, then he'll let it be destroyed and simply keep fighting till he wins and then wait for some of his fodder from hachinosu to come and get him.

What is important tho is pudding. It seems like BB took her so that she can read RP rubbings for him, so he can't have her die. But maybe saving her will be easy since aokiji should still be on board, Idk why he hasn't appeared yet, maybe cuz he's supposed to guard pudding.

But if they successfully sink the ship and aokiji doesn't freeze it and the water around it (which would stop the ship from sinking), then they could force BB to leave them be and save pudding instead.

There's also the chance that the ship itself is important to BB since it's name is saber of xebec. And he clearly has some connection to him. Other than the ship's name there's also the fact that he took over hachinosu that was ruled by a former rocks pirate.

But what I meant with diving with the submarine was if law and his crew went back in there and tried to escape. That wouldn't work since BB forced them out of the water in the first place. With his quakes he made the water pressure rise top high for the submarine thus forcing them to go up.

Now they can dive since BB is busy with law (if he tried to do something other than fighting law then the latter would immediatly punish him with a shockwille lol). But if they were to escape then BB could freely attack them with his quakes as long as they are within his range.


Either way, I'd be hella happy if law could get out of this alive. I hope he does although it looks quite grim for him

81.author: Ulzzang1
81.body:
What I'm saying is that it doesn't exist within the Strawhats. It goes from Luffy then to the rest who are equal on the same scale.

Luffy never made anyone vice or assistant captain, everyone just fulfills their respective roles in the group. From Combatant, Navigator, Sniper, Cook, Doctor, Archeologist, Shipwright, Musician and Helmsman, that's how the SHs are.

81.author: Less_Musician1950
81.body:
That's inherently wrong.   

I don't know how much more clear things can be. I'm not arguing with you about how the strawhats function, I'm telling you words mean.    

If someone is in charge when Luffy is not there, they are the vice captain.   

A crew requires someone to be in charge.   
If Luffy is not there, the crew still exists.   

LITERALLY HOW WORDS WORK: someone is acting captain.     

Any of these words meaning anything should finish this conversation.    

Finally, even if this did matter, which is doesn't, because of everything I said twice now, at least, find me a single moment of a strawhat taking authority that isn't Zoro.  

He is the one that takes responsibility (the leaders job), and the one sets the rules.  

https://youtu.be/ZZDw036Vz_w?t=96     

https://youtu.be/0hAaBXqvq8A?t=167       


This discussion is ridiculous. Unless you're under the assumption that the crew stops existing when Luffy is unconscious or off on his own, then there is a vice captain.

81.author: Ulzzang1
81.body:
When Luffy wasn't with them in Wano, who took charge?? Nobody even though Zoro was there, everyone was just about doing their own thing, it still doesn't mean they're aren't a crew

I can't remember a time Zoro took charge of the crew. If we're calling anybody who has taken charge a vice captain then we can call Nami and Sanji vice captains

81.author: Less_Musician1950
81.body:
I literally gave you two links that show zoro taking charge of the crew.    


Also in wano they were directly following luffy/laws orders.   


I'm starting to think you don't read/watch one piece.  

You're certainly not reading my comments, which makes sense considering I keep having to repeat myself.

81.author: Ulzzang1
81.body:
In the first link he wasn't taking charge he was just giving a counsel to Luffy about he being a captain and it was still up to Luffy to decide for himself.

His sacrifice at Thriller Bark was also him trying to give his life for Luffy not really taking charge of the crew and lest you forget Sanji tried doing the same thing but he knocked him out. So it could have been Sanji.

Sanji has taken the lead different times in the story like in Water 7 where he was the first person to go after Robin and know what to do, in Dressrosa he not Zoro went to stop Doflamingo from hurting the crew.

Sanji's protecting his crew in WCI can also be likened to what happened in Thriller Bark since he was giving himself up for the crew to be safe.

I'm not denying Zoro hasn't taking responsibility for the crew, all I'm saying is that it is not just him, Sanji had done it, Nami has done it.

In Wano they weren't following Luffy or Law's orders, Usopp, Robin, Franky and the Heart Pirates were following Kinemon's instructions, maybe you need to rewatch Act 1 of Wano again. Luffy never gave explicit orders to the crew about what to do in Wano when he was leaving for WCI in Zou.

And back to the reason for this argument, the SHs don't have a vice captain or assistant captain. Even in the last released Bounty chapter they were all called officers with their respective roles, no one was called vice captain. The Strawhats Pirates aren't like other crews where an hierarchy exists between members, they're all equal except for Luffy who is captain over all of them. If you really think otherwise maybe you're the one who hasn't been reading or watching OP

Dude the reason they are in this position is because of Roger. They couldn't do anything about it and it's become so big that they are losing thier control. 
Why do you think the navy is setup. pirates aside dragon alone with his organisation is making them sweat. Why the need for complicated power structure when you're such a powerhouse. 84.author: redeyez92
84.body:
Pretty Sure the gorosei existed before Roger. The reason i say this is because they ask Imu what light to extinguish now and state that it is "again" time for a great cleansing. Which tells me they have gotten to this Point before and simply wiped the slate clean by slaughtering enough people to write History anew. I am of the opinion that the gorosei are void century Boys. Again. This is only my View in These Things. Not even in the least confirmed. Just me adding things together. 
As to the need for Power structure when you can Just go and solo pretty much everyone is simple and straightforward. Its taxing and annoying. Way more comfortable to create an Organisation tasked with enforcing "Justice" and then just pop in when the underlings arent enough anymore. Its the Same principle as yonkou or basically any ruling entity. Governing is a Lot of work enough without you having to stamp out every little Rebellion yourself
